message: @davidhodge nope, this is my first time.
@davidhodge we've done the same thing :P Pre-booked a two week stay in the Mission District.
(Shameless plug, I made the iBART iPhone App.)
Interested in knowing who will be around in San Fran, Mountain View etc during the interview period.
It's an awesome place.
You flying into SFO?
We'll be there regardless of what we find out tomorrow! Going apartment hunting.
Have you been to SF before?
The idea was the paid version was commuter oriented and the free one was still quitte functional
Trip planning?
or something else?
Nice! We flew up about a month ago. Liked the mission. We're going to try to find something in the Haight or Berkeley probably.
TIp: The BART only goes up and down SF
heh. I like berkeley. It's got some cool stuff
24th
lol
@davidhodge I'll be looking forward to visiting the Golden Gate and Alcatraz
!@davidhodge yeah flying into SFO. An iPhone app would be perfect
Ah great. Also, make sure to try out the food selection. There's some great food in SF.
If you are, you can take the BART to get right to the mission.
you wont need live when coming from the airport
yep. SFO to 16th st or 24th st mission.
depending on your destination.
BART also goes to the east bay
I'd guess so. But with international, the time of the day is almost irrelevant at arrival.
What day of the week?
haha. no. why did you do this to me!
if you arrive on time, you'll have an hour and twenty four minutes. So you should be good
I don't want to say now... :P
Last time I went though US customs it was pretty slick.
I'm assuming since it's near midnight the queues should be shorter?
I do like travel apps, like National Rail's in the UK.
http://itunes.apple.com/us/app/ibart-free/id288656960?mt=8 that should help! Let me know if you have any feedback.
takes a good 15 minutes to get to BART once you clear customs though
yeah
I must confess. There's a crasher in there. Your odds of finding it are slim, but if you do I'm sorry.
yes sir.
We're making a platform out of our transportation Apps actually.
lemme think. Customs
it only splits up when you get to oakland, but you don't want to go there
oh. you might not make the last train.
yeah, done that before. They have free shuttles. that's a good option. Ahh, now I'm just helping you plan your trip instead of doing work
And trip planning is done locally, so that helps out a lot. You'll be able to plan trips underground / with no signal.
Suggested stations for SFO to Mission?
lol
Um...
Hold one second.
What are you applying with?
I do like their live maps, where you can follow which stops you're currently at and where the train is. Helpful for when I'm a bit "spacey" and forget to listen to the announcements.
What's the difference between free and live?
haha.
So to get from the Airport to my house will be $109
The app is cool though.
Anyway to save trips?
@davidhodge by upgrade do you mean Live has it?
The whole app.
Pretty awesome.
It's a bit boring.

primarily real-time data. In the free version all arrivals are schedule based. In the live version the arrivals page connects to the trains. So you know when your train will arrive instead of when it should arrive.
okay
yeah. Trips to and from the airport cost extra.
the mission is pretty walkable. It's a cool place. Can be a little sketchy at night though. When d o you arrive.
*next
Plane lands at like 22:30 I think.
It's bad that as soon as I posted that I thought of Rebecca Black...
lol
Will likely be using it a lot in SF.
Hit the 9 by mistake :P
Took maybe 10 minutes, most of which was a queue.
If not we'll just try and get a room at the nearby inns for the night.
Ah awesome, I'll get it then.
Wish I could try out the location-based features, need to wait until I'm in SF.
@davidhodge are you applying to YC?
great to hear!
Thanks! I try to spend quality time with the performance tools :)
With that.
Friday
It's pretty good as an app (National Rail) just needs a little bit of work in terms of the UI.
no. you should be fine.
well, it'll rememebr the last origin/destination. Otherwise that's an upgrade :)
haha. We've been thinking about a feature like that. Can be hard to get right if you have a shakey internet connection and trains aren't on schedule
@davidhodge the app is really fast.
Just visited the website :P
Would it be possible to simply tell the user which stations they are between?
As the map just made it clunky, all I wanted to know was where we were stopping nex.
what do you think?
did you find that one pretty practical? I try to download every one I can find. If I remember correctly I had some issues with that one
(glad to hear you like the site, btw! Thanks)

Offhandedly, we could with 95% accuracy. But there are some stretchs where things stay underground, have no signal and tend to run off schedule. For that kind of thing we ride on the train and experiment :) haven't found something I'm happy with yet. At least not for BART
but for a regular above-ground train. absolutely
alright. I've really got to get working. Night night. good luck.
@davidhodge cya and thanks :D
np. with some luck on both sides we'll be seeing eachother at yc
Yah :D
if not. we're still working in a pretty small world.
Akshell (http://www.akshell.com) will be around as well no matter what, keen to meet other YC applicants, so definitely up for an ad-hoc meetup
Hey, if we're all in SF/MV at the same time we should meet up for coffee, set up a sort of ad-hoc Y Combinator for a couple of days
@oleg are you guys familiar with Cappuccino & 280North? http://cappuccino.org/
we're using cappuccino for the IDE - we don't know any of the guys personally
@oleg where are you planning on staying? Im planning on being in SF for a week anyway
280north is a good group. nice guys. And ofcourse Cappuccino is awesome
If anyone wants to meet up, let us know - contact@receivd.com
@oleg i like the simple ui of akshell, compared to cloud9ide

Erbix (http://www.erbix.com) will be around for a chat so if you're interested for a meetup about the Erbix AppStore for your domain, JavaScript in general or a browser-based IDE, drop us a note at www.erbix.com/feedback/ and we'll sync up on the 23rd :)
heh, twilk doesn't work so well in that context
are you doing something smart? :-P
Receivd (http://receivd.com) will be around
airbnb should have special YC hopeful deals
